headline: RTX and Other Defense Stocks Fall After Trump Says He’ll Ban Dividends, Buybacks
summary: Trump said defense contractors are too slow to deliver equipment and too slow to maintain and repair equipment.

headline: Defense stocks fall after Trump threatens to ban dividends, buybacks
summary: Investing.com -- Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) stock fell 1.7%, Northrop Grumman (NYSE:NOC) dropped 2%, and other defense names were pressured Wednesday afternoon after President Donald Trump threatened to prohibit dividends and stock buybacks for defense companies.

raw.headline: Defense stocks fall after Trump threatens to ban dividends, buybacks

headline: Crisis in the Caribbean: The Defense Sector Playbook
summary: Demand is tilting to precision missiles and border surveillance, spotlighting RTX, LHX, and EMBJ stocks as arsenals refill and logistics tighten rapidly in 2026.

headline: Is It Time To Reassess L3Harris Technologies (LHX) After Its Strong 1-Year Share Price Run?
summary: If you are wondering whether L3Harris Technologies at around US$314 a share is offering good value right now, you are not alone. The stock sits in a part of the market where price and expectations are closely watched. The share price has returned 6.4% over the last 7 days, 12.9% over the last 30 days, 3.3% year to date, 57.9% over 1 year, 66.0% over 3 years and 88.2% over 5 years, which naturally raises questions about how the current price lines up with fundamentals. Recent headlines around...
